title: Protesters arrested at Adelaide rally by Extinction Rebellion
text:
Two protesters lying on the ground were taken away by police during a climate rally organised by Extinction Rebellion.

The three-hour protest, attended by about 500 people, started at Rundle St and moved to North Tce around 6.30pm.

media_camera Protesters and police at the Extinction Rebellion protest for climate change action in Rundle Mall. Picture: AAP / Morgan Sette

A group of protesters hooked arms and sat on the ground.

But when a man decided to lie down, the rally escalated and he was dragged off by four police officers to a paddywagon.

A protester at the @XRSouth was taken away by police just minutes ago as the rally moved from Rundle Mall to North Terrace. pic.twitter.com/S2h3z944Jj — Josephine Lim (@johzlim) October 11, 2019

media_camera Police carry a protester. Picture: AAP / Morgan Sette media_camera A woman climbs a traffic light pole. Picture: AAP / Morgan Sette

A female protester also climbed on to a traffic light pole.

An officer warned the group to “cease loitering” and moved to the footpath but a group of protesters linked a wall of arms again.

Another man, who said his name was John McCallum, laid on the bitumen and was also carted off by police officers.

media_camera Protester John McCallum is arrested by police at an Extinction Rebellion demonstration in Adelaide. Picture: Josephine Lim

A police spokeswoman said those arrested were a 61-year-old man from Inman Valley, failing to cease loiter, and a 44-year-old man from Bridgewater, remaining on roadway.

Both received a caution.

media_camera Protestors link hands and hold signs on North Terrace. Picture: AAP / Morgan Sette

Extinction Rebellion SA spokeswoman Peta Page said Friday’s rally was the biggest turnout after different planned events took place across Adelaide CBD this week.

She said the protesters originally planned the rally on the intersection of Rundle St and Pulteney St but police had blocked off Pulteney St between North Tce and Grenfell St.

“We moved (the rally to North Tce) because we weren’t causing any civil disobedience,” she said.

The group will meet for their last event for the week at Hindmarsh Sq on Saturday.
description: Two men have been arrested during a protest on North Terrace — days after group members said action would escalate until exactly that happened.
